sentences.english: She is very religious and goes to church three times a week.
sentences.chinese: 她非常虔诚，每周去教堂三次。

sentences.english: They asked these questions very sincerely, never talked about anything metaphysically.
sentences.chinese: 向得极其虔诚，就是不谈玄虚。

sentences.english: And then, one-pointed trust and devotion towards the Manjushri.
sentences.chinese: 然后，对文殊菩萨具有全然的信任和虔诚。

sentences.english: Instead, I say piously that all I want are three things.
sentences.chinese: 相反，我很虔诚的说，我追求的只有三件事。

sentences.english: I want to pray to God with my utmost sincere heart and I am willing to sacrifice my life to plead God for rain.
sentences.chinese: 我要用最虔诚的心向天神祷告，愿舍身祈求上天降雨。

sentences.english: They all reverently bowed their heads and hearts.
sentences.chinese: 全家人都虔诚地低下了头，在心里致敬。

sentences.english: Devout men buried Stephen and made great lamentation over him.
sentences.chinese: 有虔诚的人把司提反埋葬了，为他捶胸大哭。

sentences.english: Don’t expect to start eating perfectly and exercising religiously tomorrow.
sentences.chinese: 不要指望开始狠狠的吃然后明天就虔诚的运动。

sentences.english: But Italians are less pious than they pretend.
sentences.chinese: 但意大利人并不像他们装得那样虔诚。

sentences.english: The devout Christian who led his country into four wars.
sentences.chinese: 正是这位虔诚的基督徒将英国卷入了四场战争。

sentences.english: You have the same warm, sincere heart.
Zen master had a faithful but very naive student who regarded him as a living buddha.
sentences.chinese: 有位禅师有个很虔诚却天真的弟子，视他为活佛。

sentences.english: From this point on, I'm going to become a devout Muslim, Zehra.
sentences.chinese: 悉拉啊，从现在开始，我要成为一个虔诚穆斯林。

sentences.english: Seek the fellowship of godly men, harken unto their words and remember them.
sentences.chinese: 与虔诚之人结交，倾听其话语并铭记在心。

sentences.english: Another thing about Kathy is that she is a devout Christian.
sentences.chinese: 还有件事情值得一提，就是她是一名虔诚的基督徒。

sentences.english: Several devout nuns live in the convent located in remote mountains.
sentences.chinese: 这个建在深山里的尼姑庵，住着几个虔诚的尼姑。

definition: to worship/to make customary deferences to/a pilgrimage
to kneel and bow with joined hands at forehead level/to worship
one who has mastered the sutras (Buddhism)
